column4: hello fellows! it's my first time here, and I'm having trouble with my wireless
today I couldn't find any available conections, but yesterday my wireless was working fine
I've tried to reinstall network manager, also tried to use ndiswrapper as well as proprietary drivers
and in windows xp, the light of the wireless board turns on, but no network is detected
Try disabling the drivers then reenabling it
then reboot
how do I do it?

until yesterday, this drivers were disabled and the wireless was working fine, but today when I turned on my laptop in the beginning it detected, but didn't connected, but after a while, it stopped detecting
it sounds like hardware problems, right?
yes, that may be a hardware issue, although I wouldnt condemn it just yet
maybe try it on a different system
i have tried all those things that i said.... the only different thing i did was to install and uninstall gufw, a firewall... ah, and uninstalling gwibber, a microblogging client
i tried in windows xp, the light of the wireless board turns on, but it doesn't detect any network
then I would be pretty inclined to throwing it out the window =P
the good part is that it's still guaranteed by sony and the store
the go for it... its a vaio?
i think i will take it to the authorized support
yes
VGN-NR330AE
thank you very much for the help!
and i'm sorry for my english
